name: Creative and Cute "C" Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following is a contraction?
questions.explanation:
can't.

	A contraction is when an apostrophe takes the place of a missing letter or letters. In this case can't is the contraction for cannot. The apostrophe takes the place of "no".

questions.text: Both Jesus and Joseph were of what profession?
questions.explanation:
carpenter.

	You can read about the life of Jesus in Matthew, Mark, Luke or John of the New Testament in The Bible.  Jesus is named as a carpenter in his own right in Mark 6:3.

questions.text: What is another word for maize?
questions.explanation:
corn.

	The cauliflower is part of the mustard family which also contains cabbage and broccoli.

questions.text: What did Jack break when he fell down the hill in the nursery rhyme "Jack and Jill"?
questions.explanation:
crown.

	Most people know the first verse but a lot of people I found out don't know any of the other verses so here's another one: "Up Jack got and home did trot, as fast as he could caper. He went to bed to mend his head with vinegar and brown paper"

questions.text: What is the musical term that means to grow louder?
questions.explanation:
crescendo.

	The opposite of crescendo is decrescendo. Decrescendo means to grow softer.

questions.text: During the Great Depression, who was Bonnie Parker's partner in crime?
questions.explanation:
Clyde Barrow.

	Bonnie and Clyde were killed on May 23, 1934 in Louisiana.

questions.text: Which of the following verbs in Spanish means "to believe"?
questions.explanation:
creer.

	Cantar means to sing. Comprar means to buy. Comer means to eat.

questions.text: What is Walker's first name in the television show "Walker, Texas Ranger"?
questions.explanation:
Cordell.

	Walker is played by Chuck Norris.

questions.text: Who played Nearly Headless Nick in the first two "Harry Potter" movies?
questions.explanation:
Cleese & John Cleese.

	John Cleese is best known as being one of the members of Monty Python.

questions.text: What position does "Today" play in the Abbott and Costello routine "Who's on First"?
questions.explanation:
Catcher.

	Center field is the only other position that is in baseball. A corner is a position in American football (shortened for cornerback), and a center is in basketball.
